newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine oil buffer fund deficit 2.3 bln pesos.
newsitem.headline: Philippine oil buffer fund deficit 2.3 bln pesos.

text.p: The Department of Energy said on Tuesday the Oil Price Stabilisation Fund's deficit had widened to 2.33 billion pesos as of end-August from the previous month's level of 2.21 billion pesos.
Petron Corp has the biggest claims of 1.09 billion pesos followed by Pilipinas Shell Petroleum Corp, a unit of Royal Dutch Shell, at 912.48 million pesos.
Caltex Philippines Inc, a joint venture between US-based Chevron Corp and Texaco Inc has claims of 388.45 million pesos.
The fund is run by the government to temper fluctuations in local oil prices.

Under the first phase of a programme to deregulate the oil industry, the government has since August allowed oil firms to adjust their prices according to international prices but it has limited the monthly rise to a maximum of 50 centavos per litre.
The buffer fund reimburses oil firms for the difference.
